On February INTNUMERIC INTNUMERIC the FERC approved Docket No. CP97-549, granting CNG 
Transmission's (CNGT's) request for reclassification of various transmission 
lines to gathering lines. DATENUMERIC As part of that Docket, several transmission lines 
were denied to gathering. DATENUMERIC On March INTNUMERIC INTNUMERIC CNGT filed for rehearing to 
further support the reclassification of the lines denied reclassification. 
reclassification of five lines from transmission lines to gathering lines. 
CNGT filed new tariff sheets to implement the reclassification effective 
April INTNUMERIC DATENUMERIC DATENUMERIC Although the FERC has not yet granted approval of the tariff 
sheets, CNGT is notifying producers that upon approval of the new tariff 
sheets, CNGT will begin charging a gathering rate of $0.198/Dt. and a fuel 
retention of DECNUMERIC for all gas moved on the lines listed above. DATENUMERIC If you have 
questions regarding this notice, please contact Nancy Aucremanne at 
Dear Pool Operator: 
CNG Transmission Corporation (CNGT) plans to take its Hastings 
Extraction Plant (H.E.P.) out of service to perform annual maintenance 
starting at DATENUMERIC a.m. on Tuesday, September INTNUMERIC DATENUMERIC DATENUMERIC This requires 
that the "wet gas" system behind the H.E.P. in West Virginia be shut in. 
The plant shutdown will last approximately twenty-one DECNUMERIC days if no 
unexpected problems arise during the shutdown. DATENUMERIC Normal plant operations 
are scheduled to resume on Tuesday, October INTNUMERIC DATENUMERIC DATENUMERIC All questions 
concerning the shut in and the subsequent turn in should be directed 
to CNGT's local operations supervisor in the production area. 
Unless other arrangements have been made to move gas to markets 
other than on CNGT, all wet gas production must be shut in by DATENUMERIC p.m. 
on Monday, September INTNUMERIC DATENUMERIC DATENUMERIC This will allow our compressor stations 
to pull down the field pressure prior to going completely down at midnight 
and will ensure that we maintain the time-lines on our schedule. DATENUMERIC As per 
CNGT's tariff, failure to shut in by DATENUMERIC p.m. will result in CNGT 
considering 
the gas to be unauthorized and it will not be credited as a delivery to your 
As the exact time the plant will resume service is very difficult 
to determine, and in an effort to minimize confusion, producers in your 
pool will need to coordinate the turn in of their production with CNGT's 
local operations supervisor. We are also asking that all pool operators 
notify producers in their pool of this shut in. DATENUMERIC CNGT will not notify 
producers individually. 
We appreciate your cooperation and assistance on this. DATENUMERIC I also wanted 
to you to know that we are attempting to complete all work necessary for us 
to avoid shutting down the plant next year. DATENUMERIC The next regularly scheduled 
shut DATENUMERIC DATENUMERIC DATENUMERIC DATENUMERIC DATENUMERIC DATENUMERIC down will not be until DATENUMERIC 
If you have any questions about this letter, please feel free to 
Nancy M. Aucremanne 
Manager, Producer Services 
And Business Agreements

Regarding your memo below, following is a status on those items: 
INTNUMERIC DATENUMERIC DATENUMERIC The pricing and consistency in pricing for handling intra-month 
changes does appear to be an issue. DATENUMERIC Since the contract didn't spell out in 
detail location by location pricing (and I think intentionally so), we 
believe the best way to handle this for April forward is to agree monthly 
(during bid week) of the process and pricing for each location. DATENUMERIC I know Chris 
Germany has prepared a proposal that I think he has discussed (generally, not 
specific numbers) with Brian, Doug and Charlie. DATENUMERIC I will ask that he forward 
this proposal TODAY and finalize the process for April ASAP. DATENUMERIC Let me know if 
you do not think a monthly process of agreeing to the changes is sufficient. 
DATENUMERIC DATENUMERIC Local production DATENUMERIC unfortunately I think we have opened a can of worms 
here. DATENUMERIC DATENUMERIC Here is what is happening: DATENUMERIC Your people are nominating this 
production (we are not even set up to do behind the citygate nominations), 
but the contracts were assigned to us in the Wholesale transaction. DATENUMERIC That 
means they were valued by us and put into our system at a value. DATENUMERIC DATENUMERIC We are 
reviewing this detail now and are finding quite a few discrepancies between 
the prices that were listed on the Wholesale Deal List and the actual 
contract prices with the producers. DATENUMERIC So, this is one issue we will have to 
address as indemnification items. DATENUMERIC That's problem one. DATENUMERIC Problem two is that I 
am assuming you all would like this production back since you are doing all 
the nominations. DATENUMERIC We need to work on a solution for doing this (if that is 
what you want). DATENUMERIC For Jan, Feb & Mar, however, it appears that we will be the 
ones paying the producers, so we will need to get volume information from 
your schedulers in order to get this billed and payed for properly. DATENUMERIC DATENUMERIC I'll 
follow up with more information on this in the next couple of days. 
DATENUMERIC DATENUMERIC Monthly invoices DATENUMERIC regarding the pipeline demand charges, it sounds like

pipeline invoices on to you. DATENUMERIC Maybe we should change this process to one 
where he sends them to you as soon as he gets them instead of waiting on his 
confirmation and review of all the charges. DATENUMERIC This means you may see quite a 
bit of incorrect data, but at least you'll have something. DATENUMERIC Let us know what 
you would prefer. DATENUMERIC Regarding the January invoice specifically, I do know that

My fault. DATENUMERIC I should have sent this out this morning. 
The attached file contains our daily volume requirements for 
contains the volumes that we need at each of the delivery points indicated. 
The schedulers will want to check this sheet to see how much gas is needed at 
specific point. 
The sheet labelled 'Daily Change' shows the change (increase +/decrease DECNUMERIC in 
the requested daily volume relative to a prior value. DATENUMERIC For the current gas 
the change is an intra-day change and is calculated using the previous day's 
volume request for the current day (e.g., If the current gas day is 3/28, then 
the change is computed with respect to the DATENUMERIC request for 3/28). DATENUMERIC For 
tomorrow's gas day and any subsequent ones shown, the change is computed using 
the First-of-the-month volumes requested for those days. DATENUMERIC (e.g., If today is 
first-of-the-month volumes for those days.) DATENUMERIC DATENUMERIC This sheet should be useful in 
determining prices for daily changes in gas volumes that we take or turn back. 
Doug Kinney 
CES Daily March Requirements for DATENUMERIC and after 
My fault. DATENUMERIC I should have sent this out this morning. 
The attached file contains our daily volume requirements for 
contains the volumes that we need at each of the delivery points indicated. 
The schedulers will want to check this sheet to see how much gas is needed at 
specific point. 
The sheet labelled 'Daily Change' shows the change (increase +/decrease DECNUMERIC in 
the requested daily volume relative to a prior value. DATENUMERIC For the current gas 
the change is an intra-day change and is calculated using the previous day's 
volume request for the current day (e.g., If the current gas day is 3/28, then 
the change is computed with respect to the DATENUMERIC request for 3/28). DATENUMERIC For 
tomorrow's gas day and any subsequent ones shown, the change is computed using 
the First-of-the-month volumes requested for those days. DATENUMERIC (e.g., If today is 
first-of-the-month volumes for those days.) DATENUMERIC DATENUMERIC This sheet should be useful in 
determining prices for daily changes in gas volumes that we take or turn back. 
Doug Kinney

this exact setup on several contracts today.

schedule. DATENUMERIC However, ENA will make the acutal injection and withdrawal

On some storage contracts, ENA will buy the gas from CES on withdrawals and 
sell the gas to CES on injections.

schedule. DATENUMERIC However, ENA will make the acutal injection and withdrawal 
decisions. DATENUMERIC Which means, what we bill CES will be different from what 
actually happens. DATENUMERIC I know this is what we did with BUG, I just don't know how

Currently these citygate production deals are deducted from the citygate 
delivery that CES needs. The numbers that Herndon LDC schedulers provide to 
Enron are reduced by the production. I think Chris put these buy/sells in the 
system to appease John and keep the Enron accounting system whole. Currently 
the market demand tickets in Sitara are reduced by the citygate supply. The 
pathing could be made easier by hooking up the citygate production supply to 
the market demand tickets, but the market demand numbers need to be 
increased. Then you could eliminate the buy/sell tickets that Chris Germany 
has been creating. 
However if this production gas is not Enron's, then Enron is creating a lot 
of unnecessary work and the producers are probably receiving two payments.

stay with Enron, should they be at EES... since they are behind the citygate 
or do they stay with Enron to reduce the TCO delivery to the citygates for 
CES? DATENUMERIC This could be a can of worms. 
Colleen, what is the contract interruption? Does the citygate production 
deals stay with Enron? If they stay with Enron, then does CES realize this? 
Are the producers receiving two payments, one from Enron and one from CES. 
Maybe this has already be discussed and decided, but I haven't heard the 
official word. 
Currently these citygate production deals are deducted from the citygate 
delivery that CES needs. The numbers that Herndon LDC schedulers provide to 
Enron are reduced by the production. I think Chris put these buy/sells in the 
system to appease John and keep the Enron accounting system whole. Currently 
the market demand tickets in Sitara are reduced by the citygate supply. The 
pathing could be made easier by hooking up the citygate production supply to 
the market demand tickets, but the market demand numbers need to be 
increased. Then you could eliminate the buy/sell tickets that Chris Germany 
has been creating. 
However if this production gas is not Enron's, then Enron is creating a lot 
of unnecessary work and the producers are probably receiving two payments.

will continue to assign CNG capacity unless a final determination in the gas 
rate case precludes Niagara Mohawk from such assignment.

last fall and the contract number for the capacity is still valid, Niagara 
Mohawk will continue to honor that contract and will not release CNG capacity 
you. DATENUMERIC However, if the contract has expired, you must either re-submit an

capacity to you. DATENUMERIC DATENUMERIC The Affidavits are due Niagara Mohawk by the 25th of March,

Chris--The attached spreadsheet contains our Daily volume requirements for DATENUMERIC 
Columns--one labelled '9AM' and one labelled 'Intraday' which is an update of 
the requirements reported in the 9AM column. DATENUMERIC DATENUMERIC The two columns will be 
identical in instances where no change has been made. DATENUMERIC DATENUMERIC Where the two numbers 
differ, the Intraday value is the latest requriement. DATENUMERIC In some cases where 
there is storage (i.e., COH Choice) INTNUMERIC you will see negative values for the 
'PRIMARY' requirement. DATENUMERIC This represents a situation where gas is being 
withdrawn from storage and sold at the pool, along with the first-of-the-month 
baseload daily 'PRIMARY' volume. 
Please call if you have questions, etc. 
Doug Kinney

This is just about my intelluctual speed. 
Collards is green, my dog's name is Blue 
and I'm so lucky to have a sweet thang like you. 
Yer hair is like cornsilk a-flappin in the breeze, 
Softer than Blue's and without all them fleas. 
You move like the bass which excite me in May. 
You ain't got no scales but I luv you anyway. 
Ye're as satisfy'n as okry jist a-fry'n in the pan. 
Ye're as fragrant as "snuff" right out of the can. 
You got some a yer teeth, for which I am proud; 
I hold my head high when we're in a crowd. 
On special occasions, when you shave under yer arms, 
well, I'm in hawg heaven, and awed by yer charms. 
Still them fellers at work,they all want to know, 
What I did to deserve such a purdy, young doe. 
Like a good roll of duct tape ye're there fer yer man, 
To patch up life's troubles and to fix what you can. 
Ye're as cute as a junebug a-buzzin' overhead. 
Not like them mean far ants dun found in my bed. 
Cut from the best cloth like a plaid flannel shirt, 
You spark up my life like a load of fresh dirt. 
When you hold me real tight like a padded gunrack, 
My life is complete;there ain't nuthin' I lack. 
Yer complexion is perfect like the best vinyl sidin'. 
Cuz despite all them years,yer age, yup it keeps hidin'. 
Me 'n' you's like a Moon Pie with a RC cold drank, 
We two go together like a skunk goes with stank. 
Some men, they buy chocolate fer Valentine's Day; 
They git it at Wal-Mart, it's romantic that way. 
Some men, they git roses fer that special day, 
From the cooler at Kroger. "That's impressive," I say. 
Some men buy fine diamonds from a flea market booth. 
"Diamonds is ferever," they explains, suave and couth. 
But fer this man, honey,these just won't do. 
Cuz ye're way too special,you sweet thang you. 
I got you a gift,without taste or odor, 
More useful than diamonds...it's a new trollin' motor!

I am pleased to announce that Terry Franklin will be joining the 
Transportation Rates team in a newly created position-the Appalachian 
Coordinator role. DATENUMERIC Terry brings years of transportation, wellhead, and Enron 
experience to the position, and we are excited to have her join the team. 
In her new position, Terry will be responsible for the following: 
? Understand the Appalachian contracts/agreements 
? Understand the gas flow methods and desired commercial results 
? Facilitate set-up of transport/gathering contracts 
? Facilitate set-up of facilities/meters 
? Create purchase deals in SITARA 
? Maintain transport rates coordination role for CGAS, CNG, CNR, etc. 
? Review calc sheets 
? Maintain purchase pricing 
? Maintain intra-month volumetric estimates on CNR/Gather co 
Terry will make every effort to trouble shoot and problem solve for both the 
commercial and operations teams. DATENUMERIC In doing so, she will be looking to partner 
with the members of the Trading, Origination, Client Services, Volume 
Management, and Logistics teams to improve our processes in this very 
important area. 
Terry will be replaced on the Operational Analysis team, but we may choose to 
realign individual responsibilities to creatively manage the DATENUMERIC current 
workload. DATENUMERIC Terry will begin to transition over the next several days, but we 
must be very careful to maintain the current Volume Mgmt. OA process during 
this transition time. 
Please join me in congratulating Terry in her new role! 
Terry Franklin-Appalachian Coordinator

which is available for service commencing March DECNUMERIC 
Name DATENUMERIC Aggregation Point DECNUMERIC 
Name DATENUMERIC Finnefrock Aggregation Point 
Rate: DATENUMERIC Maximum Demand DATENUMERIC DATENUMERIC Effective Tariff Max (Currently DECNUMERIC 
Primary Term: Commencing March INTNUMERIC DATENUMERIC through March INTNUMERIC DATENUMERIC 
Bids will be evaluated using the Net Revenue criteria of Section 23.3.B.2 
of CNG's FERC Gas Tariff. Subject to the open-access requirements of Parts 
DATENUMERIC and DATENUMERIC of the Commission's regulations, unless mutually agreed otherwise 
in consideration of relevant operational and market factors, CNG reserves the 
right to reject any bids at less than its maximum applicable rates. 
CNG also reserves the right to reject contingent bids and bids from any party 
that does not qualify for service in accordance with all applicable 
of CNG's FERC Gas Tariff.

Dear Producers and Shippers, 
In January, you were notified that the Schultz Gas Processing Plant 
would be permanently shut down on February INTNUMERIC DATENUMERIC DATENUMERIC DATENUMERIC We heard from many 
of you regarding the financial hardship this shut down may cause Schultz 
area producers while a gas delivery alternative was being constructed. 
Given your concerns and given that natural gas liquids prices have risen 
sufficiently to allow operations at Schultz to be marginally profitable, 
CNG Transmission will continue to operate the Schultz facility until: 
DATENUMERIC it becomes uneconomic to continue operations or, 
DATENUMERIC CNG develops a compression/pipeline alternative for delivering and 
processing the Schultz area gas elsewhere on its system. 
We remain committed to serving producers throughout the Appalachian 
Basin and hope this operating decision addresses the concerns voiced by you. 
If you have any questions regarding this notice, please contact Joe Thompson 
H. Dale Rexrode 
Director, Producer Services 
and Business Development

Scott--My March '00 first-of-the-month numbers for AGL assumed that the total 
daily firm load across all DATENUMERIC pools would average INTNUMERIC dth/day. DATENUMERIC This would 
met by a combination of maximizing the daily withdrawals from IBSS as well as 
the Directly assigned storage supplies with the remainder served by flowing 
gas. DATENUMERIC DATENUMERIC On days when the firm requirement falls below the INTNUMERIC (for March INTNUMERIC 
our combined DSR is currently 23,758dth), I don't want to reduce IBSS 
withdrawals because we need to maximize those thru March in order to have that 
inventory down to the DECNUMERIC level by March DATENUMERIC DATENUMERIC Otherwise, we could be liable 
penalties. DATENUMERIC DATENUMERIC Instead, I would prefer to swing on the flowing gas, if necessary 
and keep drawing the gas out of storage. 
Please call me if you have questions or wish to discuss further.

the AGL DSR.

Love and Life 
You're probably gone anyway. DATENUMERIC I'll think of this as "my note in a bottle". 
Stumpy and his wife Martha went to the state fair every year. Every year 
Stumpy would say, "Martha, I'd like to ride in that there airplane." And 
every year Martha would say, "I know Stumpy, but that airplane ride costs 
ten dollars, and ten dollars is ten dollars." 
One year Stumpy and Martha went to the fair and Stumpy said, "Martha, I'm 
DATENUMERIC years old. If I don't ride that airplane this year I may never get 
another chance." Martha replied, "Stumpy that there airplane ride costs ten 
dollars, and ten dollars is ten dollars." 
The pilot overheard them and said, "Folks, I'll make you a deal. I'll take 
you both up for a ride. If you can stay quiet for the entire ride and not 
say one word, I won't charge you, but if you say one word it's ten 
Stumpy and Martha agreed and up they go. The pilot does all kinds of twists 
and turns, rolls and dives, but not a word is heard. He does all his tricks 
over again, but still not a word. 
They land and the pilot turns to Stumpy, "By golly, I did everything I 
could think of to get you to yell out, but you didn't." Stumpy replied, 
"Well, I was gonna say something when Martha fell out, but ten dollars is 
ten dollars." 
FW: A little flying humor 
Jim asked me to forward this to you. DATENUMERIC We should probably discuss this. 
Transport Rates 
Something for you to consider: 
If the transport people are to have their own books, my belief is that the 
curve setting used for the transport values ought to be as unbiased as 
possible. DATENUMERIC This means using as few "formula based" curves as possible and as 
many Gas Daily publication postings as possible. DATENUMERIC I'm not sure how you or 
your traders feel about the following postings, (how realistic they are), but 
I think they bear watching to see if they could be used for calculating 
transport p&l. DATENUMERIC In Gas Daily, under Citygate, Pooling Point Prices, there are 
Mid Atlantic Citygates postings for both CNG and Columbia Gas. DATENUMERIC These could 
potentially be used for CNG North & South Citygates and TCO citygates. DATENUMERIC The 
only thing I have to confirm is how these would load since there is no index 
posted each day--it is a range of prices instead. 
Historically TCO and CNG citygate postings haven't been much of an issue 
because we haven't held much transport on CNG and TCO, but with the CES 
business in our portfolio, the times have changed. DATENUMERIC Currently we are using 
"formula based" curves set by the traders to calculate CNG and TCO transport 
p&l, and there sure seems to be a huge difference between the postings and 
how we are marking the curves. DATENUMERIC For example, today's Gas Daily postings 
compared to our curve markings are as follows: 
GAS DAILY DATENUMERIC DATENUMERIC GAS DAILY SPREAD DATENUMERIC DATENUMERIC SPREADS per TRADERS CURVES 
Obviously there are huge differences, so someone must be wrong. DATENUMERIC There are 
two solutions that I see. DATENUMERIC One is to switch to the Gas Daily posting, which 
in my mind is preferable if you believe the postings are accurate; the other 
solution is to have the traders change their curves more often to more 
closely reflect the actual spreads in the marketplace. DATENUMERIC That's up to you. 
Obviously if we believe the postings are completely off base and our spreads 
are more accurate, then nothing needs to be done, but if you want to know 
what you're really making on your transport (and you now have a lot of it), 
we need to focus on it being accurate. 
Anyway, let me know what you decide and I'll either forget about it or work 
on getting the Gas Daily postings pulled into the calculations. 
Mark wanted me to let you know where a few city gate points are settling 
CNG North City Gate DECNUMERIC GD CNG North DECNUMERIC 
CNG South City Gate DECNUMERIC Settles at what the intra-month trader sets their 
intra-month curve at. 
TECO Citygate DECNUMERIC GD CGT/App DECNUMERIC 
Please note that CNG North City and TECO City settle prices come in at a one 
day lag. DATENUMERIC After we receive gas daily settles, we reload prices for any 
derived curves. 
If you have any questions please let me know.

Clayton Vernon 
Vince and Vasant: 
Here is a brief summary of my meeting with Chris Germany, Capacity Trader at 
the East Desk, related to gas transmission: 
Typically, pipelines lease capacity billed on a monthly basis. An example 
might be the pipeline between South Texas and Brooklyn, where you might pay 
payment. Variable charges are DECNUMERIC for fuel costs ("shrinkage") and DECNUMERIC for 
overhead expenses. DATENUMERIC A gas trader might call South Texas and be quoted a 
delivery price tomorrow of NYMEX DATENUMERIC DECNUMERIC ("basis"), and might call Brooklyn 
and be quoted a delivered price of NYMEX INTNUMERIC DECNUMERIC DATENUMERIC DATENUMERIC The trader's spread is 
DECNUMERIC and variable costs of transmission are DECNUMERIC so the trader would 
offer the leaseholder of capacity up to DECNUMERIC for firm capacity tomorrow. 
As for the distinction betweem firm and interruptible, the leaseholders have 
an excellent knowledge of the firm-equivalent of interruptible capacity. 
Also, many pipelines don't discount firm capacity from the tariff maximum 
("it's not worth their time to haggle") (There is a further issue of 
"secondary markets" not important to the model yet). DATENUMERIC For South Texas and 
Brooklyn, there are several different routes the gas can physically take 
(pipelines of Enron, Texas Eastern, etc). DATENUMERIC And, once the trade is in the 
system traders can cover the (Enron) positions on each end of the pipeline, 
in so doing freeing up the capacity for other contracts.

FYI DATENUMERIC You may already be aware of this but I'm passing this on in case you 
didn't know this. 
Storage deals require a meter on both the injection side and the withdrawal 
side in order to bridge DATENUMERIC even if there is only a demand charge. 
A zone is not enough, it must have a meter. DATENUMERIC Let me know if that works.

Point electric generation facility. DATENUMERIC The variable transport cost on Cove Point

during the January INTNUMERIC but can be withdrawn any time before the end of the

cow/calf operations on a five year program/depreciation. DATENUMERIC If I built fence 
and that particular piece of property sold before the five years was up, 
then I was reinversed the balance of my initial fence/material investment, 
excluding my labor. DATENUMERIC Something to think about. DATENUMERIC I hope we do not own that 
place for five more years. DATENUMERIC Gerald also said he would mow the grass around

A man was stopped by a game-warden in Northern Michigan recently with 
buckets of fish leaving a lake well known for its fishing. The game 
asked the man, "Do you have a license to catch those fish?" 
The man replied to the game warden, "No, sir. These are my pet fish." 
"Pet fish?!" the warden asked. 
"Yes, sir. Every night I take these here fish down to the lake and let 
swim around for a while. I whistle and they jump back into their 
and I take em home." 
"That's a bunch of hooey! Fish can't do that!" 
The man looked at the game warden for a moment, and then said, "Here, 
show you. It really works." 
"O.K. I've GOT to see this!." The game warden was curious, now. 
The man poured the fish in to the lake and stood and waited. 
After several minutes, the game warden turned to the man and said, 
"Well, What?" the man responded. 
"When are you going to call them back?" The game warden prompted. 
"Call who back?" The man asked. 
"The fish." replied the warden. 
"What fish?" The man asked. 
FW: Pet Fish

Natural Gas Futures End Higher 
Natural gas futures on the NYMEX closed higher yesterday as traders 
sought to cover their short positions due to a feeling that the market was 
oversold following the steep decline of the last several days. The June 
contract climbed 
was basically just marking time until the AGA releases the latest storage 
injection figures this afternoon. The AGA is expected to announce an 
addition to storage of about DATENUMERIC Bcf. A somewhat lower injection could spark 
a rally because the market has already discounted a triple digit build. 
However, an injection of over DATENUMERIC Bcf could send the market to DECNUMERIC in a 
hurry. A year ago, stocks for the same week rose DATENUMERIC Bcf, and the five-year 
average injection is DATENUMERIC Bcf. Since the AGA began reporting storage data, the 
highest ever recorded was DATENUMERIC Bcf in DATENUMERIC If current weather models hold up, 
the Midwest and Texas will escape much of the summer's hottest temperatures, 
and right now, temperatures are mild across most of the nation. Look for 
technical support at the DECNUMERIC level, and resistance is expected at DECNUMERIC 
Natural gas for next day delivery across the US and Canada generally slipped 
DECNUMERIC DATENUMERIC DECNUMERIC per MMBtu yesterday, except in the west where most spot prices 
rose due to hot weather. Natural for next day delivery at the Henry hub

Fuel Cells DATENUMERIC Unveils New Career Center 
Fuel Cells DATENUMERIC has launched an online resource center for individuals 
interested in pursuing a professional career in the fuel cell industry. DATENUMERIC The 
resource was created in response to the hundreds of emails and letters 
inquiring about employment opportunities in the growing fuel cell job 
market. The Fuel Cell Career Center 
(www.fuelcells.org/careercenter/fccenterhome.html) provides information in 
three separate areas of activity DATENUMERIC Education, Employment Opportunities, and 
Professional Development DATENUMERIC to service every stage of the job search, from 
laying the groundwork with a fuel cell-focused degree to training and 
workshops at the professional level. DECNUMERIC The Educational Activities section 
includes background information for students interested in pursuing an 
undergraduate or graduate degree involving fuel cell technologies, 
internship opportunities and information on curriculum materials and 
educational kits for teachers. DECNUMERIC For job seekers, the Employment 
Opportunities section of the Career center has listings and links to 
websites offering jobs within the fuel cell industry, company profiles to 
learn more about individual fuel cell companies and their activities, and 
will soon have job posting boards for companies to display employment 
listings. DECNUMERIC For Professional Activities, Fuel Cells DATENUMERIC has compiled a 
listing of workshops and seminars to provide opportunities for information 
exchange and networking in the fuel cell industry as well as links to 
Professional Associations related to engineering, fuel cells and renewable 
"New Horizons Solutions for the 21st Century" 
An Energy Efficiency Workshop and Exposition 
Kansas City, Missouri 
TransCanada to Sell Natural Gas Marketing Unit 
TransCanada PipeLines plans to sell its money losing natural gas 
marketing unit to concentrate on more profitable power generating plants and 
pipelines. It expects to begin the sale process within the next couple of 
months. The natural gas marketing unit had a C$6 million loss in the first 
quarter, compared with a C$10 million profit a year ago. Last year, 
TransCanada shed C$3.4 billion in unprofitable businesses.

Enron's Lay Calls for Open Access to Transmission Grid 
Ken Lay, chairman of Enron, says that generators should have easier 
access to the power grid. Lay spoke after receiving the US Energy 
Association's DATENUMERIC US Energy Award, saying that today we don't have open 
access to the transmission grid, and we could get more power into the West 
if we had open access. He says the FERC should open up the power grid 
throughout the nation so generators no longer have to pay a series of 
separate fees to move electricity from one region to another. He also says 
FERC has the authority to open up the power grid in the same way that 
natural gas pipeline transmissions work. It's clear we've under-invested in 
energy infrastructure in the last DATENUMERIC to DATENUMERIC years, and it's going to take a 
few years to correct that. 
And now there's FASB DATENUMERIC DATENUMERIC So history will affect reported earnings, because 
hedge efficiencies and derivative valuations will hit the bottom line.

DATENUMERIC Challenge, visit www.fame-energy.com 
Kinder Morgan and Calpine Offer DATENUMERIC Open Seasons 
for Sonoran Pipeline 
Kinder Morgan Energy Partners and Calpine have announced that two open 
seasons have begun and will continue through June 1st on the recently 
announced Sonoran Pipeline. DATENUMERIC A binding open season is being held on Phase 
One of Sonoran DATENUMERIC which would run from the San Juan Basin in New Mexico to 
the California border DATENUMERIC to give shippers the opportunity to commit to firm 
capacity on the pipeline. DATENUMERIC A non-binding open season is being held 
simultaneously on Phase Two of the project DATENUMERIC which would extend the pipeline 
from the California border to the San Francisco Bay area DATENUMERIC to give potential 
shippers the opportunity to express their interest in obtaining firm 
capacity to California delivery points. DATENUMERIC Sonoran has received a binding 
commitment from Calpine Energy Services for INTNUMERIC Dth per day on Phase One 
and a non-binding commitment for INTNUMERIC Dth per day for Phase Two. The 
proposed pipeline will be a 1,030-mile, high-pressure interstate natural gas 
pipeline from the San Juan Basin in northern New Mexico to markets in 
California and is projected to be in-service date by the summer of DATENUMERIC 
Progas Storage Services, Inc 
was recently organized to offer specialized natural gas storage services to 
marketers and end users servicing the upper Midwest and Northeast market 
regions along the major transmission systems in Indiana, Illinois, Kentucky, 
and Michigan. PGSMI has DATENUMERIC bcf of potential working capacity which will 
offer service along TXG, ANR, Midwestern, and is currently evaluating for 
purchase another DATENUMERIC bcf of potential working capacity which can be serviced 
by these and other systems in the region. PGSMI also explores for natural 
gas in the Gulf Coast region through a wholly owned subsidiary. Progas 
intends to go public through a route of private industry offerings, and an 
IPO or registration. For more information on services or the company mail 
The company's executive and administrative office is located in Abilene, 
Texas with storage operations in Owensboro, KY and exploration operations in 
Corpus Christi, TX. 
Progas Storage Services, Inc 
Power Suppliers to Meet with California Governor 
Executives from energy suppliers are meeting with Californias governor 
today, and several are willing to discuss concessions that include price 
limits on power sold within the state. Last week the governor said he would 
seek to force the suppliers to accept reduced payment for billions of 
dollars owed by the states utilities. In the face of a state investigation 
into alleged market manipulation, some generators are willing to discuss 
limits on prices for some electricity sold to the state. Williams says it is 
prepared to support temporary price controls that would extend through the 
summer of DATENUMERIC Williams is also willing to discuss a range of possible 
alternatives for repayment of past debts owed to it. Reliant will reiterate 
an earlier offer to sell some electricity to the state at DECNUMERIC per MWh if the 
buyer will pay for the natural gas to generate the power. Duke Energy has 
proposed accepting less than full payment for power sold to the state in 
return for an end to state and federal investigations into the prices they 
charged. Duke, Enron, AES, Dynegy, Mirant, El Paso Energy, Reliant, and 
Williams will all send executives to Sacramento to the meeting. 
GasTrader.Net 
BULLS CAUTIOUS 
In spite of slip sliding natural gas prices, analysts are still cautiously 
bullish. There seems to be little incentive to abandon the bullish cause 
with the prospects of hot summer weather looming."This is a weak market, but 
I think that below DECNUMERIC you have to anticipate the return of industrial 
demand. It's really a wild card as to whether that demand will take the edge 
off the current large injections. Over the past month, the market has gone 
through a major change. Production has increased, storage DATENUMERIC is higher, and 
the injection last week at DATENUMERIC BCF was the largest since June of 1998,' says 
George Ellis, broker analyst with BNP Paribas, New York. "I was skeptical of 
the whole concept of demand erosion, but it's obviously real and when you 
combine that with an increase in production, the supply demand balance 
becomes clear. There is potentially more room to the downside, but the wild 
card is weather and if that kicks in, prices could move sharply higher. If 
prices fell to DECNUMERIC then that would be a reason to put on another DECNUMERIC 
hedge. As long as we're holding these prices I think there's a good chance 
prices will rally higher. I'm cautiously bullish. I would not be an 
aggressive seller," he said.

Blackouts Hit California Again 
California residents suffered through a second day of rolling blackouts 
yesterday as temperatures soared, driving demand ahead of supply. The 
California ordered that as of DATENUMERIC PM the state's utilities must cut DATENUMERIC MW. 
Blackouts had been forecast by the ISO since early in the morning with the 
heat coming at a time when many power plants are still off-line for 
maintenance. The Los Angeles Department and Power, was as usual was excluded 
from the blackouts. The LADWP is not under the ISO's control and has more 
than enough generation to meet its demand. The ISO said demand was running 
about INTNUMERIC MW above Monday's levels. Earlier Tuesday, the ISO had projected 
blackouts could be ordered before noon, but the return to service of two 
500-kilovolt lines operated by BC Hydro meant more power was able to flow 
south. About DATENUMERIC MW produced by small suppliers, known as Qualifying 
Facilities, are currently offline because they have not been paid. The hot 
temperatures are likely to continue today, with the threat of more

An English teacher was explaining to the students 
concept of gender 
association in the English language; noting how 
hurricanes at one time were 
given only female names, and how ships and planes 
usually referred to 
as "she." One of the students raised her hand and 
"What gender is a 
The teacher wasn't certain and divided the class 
groups:? males 
in one, females in the other, and asked them to 
a computer should 
be masculine or feminine. Both groups were asked 
four reasons for 
their recommendations. 
??? The group of women concluded that computers 
referred to as 
masculine because: 
DATENUMERIC In order to get their attention, you have to 
DATENUMERIC They have a lot of data but are still clueless. 
DATENUMERIC They are supposed to help you solve your 
problems, but 
half the time, 
they ARE the problem. 
DATENUMERIC As soon as you commit to one, you realize that, 
had waited a 
little longer, you could have had a better model. 
??? The men, on the other hand, decided that 
should definitely be 
referred to as feminine because: 
DATENUMERIC No one but their creator understands their 
DATENUMERIC The native language they use to communicate 
computers is 
incomprehensible to everyone else.

If you nom from Onshore straigt to Leach, you pay Comm (meaning without ACA 
or GRI) and ACA, the ship Leach to TCO Citygate and pay Comm INTNUMERIC ACA INTNUMERIC GRI. 
If you go from Leach to your TCO pool, you pay the same CGLF stuff and no 
charge on TCO at all. 
Next question, you have SST and you go from the pool to STOI, you pay the 
SST Comm INTNUMERIC ACA INTNUMERIC GRI into storage. DATENUMERIC When you use SST to go from STOW to the 
Citygate, you only pay Comm, no ACA or GRI (i think).

Based on a request by Dennis Bond, a new report has been added that allows 
external customers to see the group, name, and description for all reports 
they can run. DATENUMERIC The report is called RPT_GROUPS_EX (group Reports), and can be 
run by internal users as well. DATENUMERIC Only reports that are available to all 
customers are included, so company specific reports will not be displayed. 
Currently the report is DATENUMERIC pages, and does not include a data file 
(description 
can be up to DATENUMERIC characters, and doesn't fit well into a spreadsheet). DATENUMERIC Dennis 
wanted to be able to give new customers something to help them get started 
the various billing report options. DATENUMERIC Since showing all reports didn't require 
that many pages, thought it might be helpful to include everything. DATENUMERIC Good 
New Report

Re: Offers for Permanent Relinquishment of Firm Capacity in 
Conjunction with the Momentum Expansion Project 
As a part of the Momentum Expansion Project ("Momentum"), 
Transcontinental Gas Pipe Line Corporation ("Transco") is 
soliciting offers for the permanent relinquishment of firm 
transportation capacity on the Transco system from Station DATENUMERIC in 
Zone DATENUMERIC or mainline receipt points in Zone DATENUMERIC to delivery points 
in Zone DATENUMERIC or Zone DATENUMERIC at or upstream of Station DATENUMERIC Subject to 
certain conditions, Transco intends to combine such relinquished 
capacity with newly constructed capacity in order to render 
service under Momentum. Offers for capacity relinquishment may 
be made only for existing transportation services provided under 
Part 284(G) of the FERC's regulations. 
Valid offers must meet the following criteria: 
DATENUMERIC The capacity offered must result in a reduction of the 
facilities otherwise required to serve the subscribing 
shippers under Momentum; 
DATENUMERIC Inclusion of relinquished capacity in the project must result 
in a lower cost of service for the project than if additional 
facilities were constructed; 
DATENUMERIC The remaining contract term for the relinquished capacity must 
not extend beyond the 15-year primary contract term of the 
Momentum service agreements; 
DATENUMERIC Offers for permanent relinquishment will not be accepted from 
shippers who nominate for service under Momentum; 
DATENUMERIC Offers must identify the specific contract(s), MDQ, receipt 
and delivery point(s) in each contract at which delivery point 
entitlements (DPEs) will be reduced as a result of the 
relinquishment of firm capacity to those points. DATENUMERIC Shippers 
will not be permitted to relinquish a geographic portion of 
any contract; and 
DATENUMERIC Offers must be unconditional, binding and irrevocable. 
Such offers must be received by Transco no later than DATENUMERIC PM 
CST on Friday, March INTNUMERIC DATENUMERIC DATENUMERIC After receipt of offers to 
relinquish capacity, Transco will finalize the design of the 
facilities to be constructed to render service under Momentum. 
Parties that submit offers to relinquish capacity will be 
notified as to whether the offer complied with the 
specifications set forth herein and whether the capacity will be 
accepted and utilized to render service under Momentum. DATENUMERIC If more 
capacity is offered than is needed under Momentum, preference 
will be given to those offers that reduce the cost of Momentum 
to the greatest degree. In the event of a tie, preference will 
next be given to those offers that have the shortest remaining 
term for the capacity relinquished. 
Shippers with relinquished capacity that is included in Momentum 
will retain all rights and responsibilities set forth in their 
Service Agreement(s), Rate Schedule FT and the General Terms and 
Conditions of Transco's FERC Gas Tariff until Momentum firm 
transportation service commences through the relinquished 
capacity. DATENUMERIC The relinquishing shipper's service agreements will 
be terminated or reduced effective on that day. Transco's 
acceptance of relinquished capacity is and will be subject to 
the following: 
DATENUMERIC Execution and delivery by the shipper to Transco of an 
agreement to permanently relinquish such firm transportation 
capacity (such agreement to be provided by Transco); 
DATENUMERIC Execution and delivery of an amendment to the shipper's firm 
transportation contract reflecting any modifications resulting 
from the relinquishment of a portion of the service related to 
such capacity, if applicable; 
DATENUMERIC Execution and delivery of firm service agreements by shippers 
subscribing to all capacity to be made available under 
DATENUMERIC Shippers relinquishing capacity will file in support of 
Transco's applications for a certificate of public convenience 
and necessity authorizing Momentum; 
DATENUMERIC Receipt of a FERC certificate authorizing the proposed 
Momentum facilities and service (including approval of 
shipper's capacity relinquishment) in a form acceptable to 
Transco in its sole opinion; and 
DATENUMERIC Placing the entire Momentum project into service. DATENUMERIC In the 
event that Momentum does not go forward for any reason, 
including, without limitation, the FERC authorizations being 
granted in a form unacceptable to Transco, the capacity 
relinquishment shall not be effectuated and all related 
agreements shall be null and void. 
Parties desiring more information regarding this announcement 
should contact Helen Laughlin at DATENUMERIC or Orlando 
Offers For Relinquishment of Firm Capacity 
Media Inquiries: Chris Stockton 
and Shippers

Chesapeake Energy stock being sorely undervalued 
By Melissa Davis 
Business Writer 
Ask the experts. Chesapeake Energy is more than a DECNUMERIC stock. 
Forget that Chesapeake is up more than DATENUMERIC percent from a year ago DATENUMERIC and up 
more than INTNUMERIC percent from its lowest days, not long ago, when it traded 
for less than DECNUMERIC Chesapeake still appears sorely undervalued. 
Last week, Chesapeake announced record fourth-quarter earnings that were 
INTNUMERIC percent higher than earnings for the same quarter in DATENUMERIC The company 
also reported a DATENUMERIC net income of DECNUMERIC a share DATENUMERIC which means you can buy 
Chesapeake for a price that is less than three times the company's earnings. 
"No stock trades for three times earnings," said Mickey Thompson, executive 
vice president of the Oklahoma Independent Petroleum Association. "The 
independent producers are all undervalued right now. Chesapeake is just the 
most undervalued." 
Chesapeake is the 10th-largest independent producer of natural gas in the 
country. And natural gas, because of low supply and high demand, is one of 
the hottest commodities on the market. It's a huge money maker. 
So Chesapeake is in the right business at the right time DATENUMERIC and it's into it 
heavily. Natural gas accounts for almost DATENUMERIC percent of all the business that 
Chesapeake does. 
This has already caught the attention of some prominent investment experts. 
Chuck Clough has picked Chesapeake as one of his favorite companies in his 
current favorite sector DATENUMERIC natural gas. And Clough isn't just anybody. Until 
a year ago, he was chief investment strategist for Merrill Lynch. Shortly 
after he left, he established a hedge fund that returned DATENUMERIC percent, after 
fees and costs, during an 11-month time period when the rest of the market 
slid DATENUMERIC and the Nasdaq tumbled DATENUMERIC percent. 
Clough's young hedge fund now boasts DECNUMERIC million in assets. 
He's not too worried about falling natural gas prices. He's invested DATENUMERIC 
percent of his portfolio in energy stocks and most of that in natural gas. 
He's convinced that companies like Chesapeake will begin trading for much 
more than two or three times their earnings DATENUMERIC and soon. 
Stephen Smith, a Houston analyst for Dain Rauscher Wessels, considers 
Chesapeake to be a top performer among the energy companies he covers. He is 
convinced the stock is undervalued and that DATENUMERIC even after gaining DATENUMERIC percent 
last year DATENUMERIC Chesapeake will have another banner year in DATENUMERIC 
"Natural gas prices don't have to stay at DECNUMERIC DECNUMERIC DECNUMERIC or DECNUMERIC for them to have 
a good year," Smith said. "The prices could drop to DECNUMERIC or DECNUMERIC and that would 
still be a wonderful doubling of what they used to be. If we can continue to 
see DECNUMERIC gas prices, then I think that energy stocks DATENUMERIC and particularly 
Chesapeake DATENUMERIC will start to respond a bit more." 
Thompson, who moves within local energy circles, is very optimistic. 
"The natural gas prices we lived with for most of the '90s will never come 
back," he said. "I can see a scenario with DECNUMERIC and DECNUMERIC gas prices for a long,

St. Mary's gas flows on Texas Gas [TGT]. 
On January 26th, TGT issued a Critical Notice, that in essence states that 
they will not accept a nom to flow gas if it doesn't meet certain pipeline 
spec criteria DATENUMERIC they will not accept gas over DATENUMERIC Btu content. DATENUMERIC St. Mary's 
gas is around DATENUMERIC Btu. DATENUMERIC Thus, this gas will have to be processed at the 
downstream Eunice Plant, or it will be shut in, starting either Monday the 
26th, or March 1st DATENUMERIC this is uncertain right now. DATENUMERIC I am working with Charlie 
Otto [Fred's group] and Jay Hartman/Brad Strong to put a processing contract 
together. DATENUMERIC Charlie has/or is working on a processing contract with Hunt 
[operator] and this contract will be pretty much the same as Hunt's 
processing contract. DATENUMERIC Since gas HAS TO be processed in order to flow, there 
is not much negotiating that will be done. 
Since the price of gas is high [and producers do not want to process] INTNUMERIC in 
the last couple months, there have been several pipelines to issue OFO's re 
Btu content. DATENUMERIC This is the first time that I know of that this has ever been 
such an issue. 
Terms of the processing contract: DATENUMERIC DECNUMERIC fee, shrink/PVR will be about DECNUMERIC 
producer keeps DECNUMERIC of the NGL's. DATENUMERIC Per Charlie, he thinks that this DECNUMERIC 
shrink/100% liquids equates to a DECNUMERIC or DECNUMERIC loss. DATENUMERIC Thus, the cost of 
processing is expected to be around DECNUMERIC to DECNUMERIC DATENUMERIC The processing contract 
will be month to month and used only when it is mandatory under the OFO. 
St. Mary's will be responsible for all fees, and shrink. DATENUMERIC As an example, if 
DATENUMERIC is flowing at the wellhead, and DATENUMERIC is VPP. DATENUMERIC then, there will be DATENUMERIC as 
VPP, DATENUMERIC as PVR/PTR [shrink], and DATENUMERIC as excess gas. 
St. Mary's would like the processing contract in ENA's name, since ENA should 
have title to the gas as it goes thru Eunice, and would just reimburse ENA 
for the DATENUMERIC cent fee, or any other actual applicable fees. DATENUMERIC Teresa DATENUMERIC can you 
put something together re this reimbursement. DATENUMERIC Charlie sees no problem in 
putting this in ENA's name, if someone sees an issue with this, please let me 
George, Melissa, Lia DATENUMERIC we will need to start nom'ing PVR/PTR. 
Chris Germany DATENUMERIC do we need a PTR contract on TGT? 
Teresa DATENUMERIC per the Production & Delivery Agrmt, it states that St. Mary's 
cannot process their gas. DATENUMERIC We will need a waiver to this section INTNUMERIC for the 
time period that processing is mandatory.

Now thats a ture "Pig Farmer" poem if I ever heard one. 
I would have sent flowers to my beloved in Ohio if someone would have given 
me her address. 
REDNECK VALENTINE! 
Collards are green, 
my dog's name is Blue 
and I'm so lucky 
to have a sweet thang like you. 
Yore hair is like cornsilk 
a-flappin in the breeze. 
Softer than Blue's 
and without all them fleas. 
You move like the bass, 
which excite me in May. 
You ain't got no scales 
but I luv you anyway. 
Yo're as satisfy'n as okry 
jist a-fry'n in the pan. 
Yo're as fragrant as &quot;snuff&quot; 
right out of the can. 
You have some'a yore teeth 
for which I am proud. 
I hold my head high 
when we're in a crowd. 
On special occasions, 
when you shave under yore arms, 
well, I'm in hawg heaven 
and awed by yore charms. 
Still them fellers at work, 
they all want to know, 
what I did to deserve 
such a purdy, young doe. 
Like a good roll of duct tape 
yo're there fer yore man, 
to patch up life's troubles 
and fix what you can. 
Yo're as cute as a junebug 
a-buzzin' overhead. 
You ain't mean like those far ants 
I found in my bed. 
Cut from the best cloth 
like a plaid flannel shirt, 
you spark up my life 
more than a fresh load of dirt. 
When you hold me real tight 
like a padded gunrack, 
my life is complete. 
Ain't nuttin' I lack. 
Yore complexion, it's perfection, 
like the best vinyl sidin' 
despite all the years, 
yore age, it keeps hidin'. 
Me &quot;n&quot; you's like a moon pie 
with a RC cold drank, 
we go together 
like a skunk goes with stank. 
Some men, they buy chocolate 
for a Valentine's Day, 
they git it at Wal-Mart, 
it's romantic that way. 
Some men git roses 
on that special day 
from the cooler at Krogers, 
that's impressive, I say. 
Some men buy fine diamonds 
from a flea market booth. 
&quot;Diamonds are forever&quot;, 
they explain, suave and couth. 
But for this man, honey, 
these won't do. 
Cause yo're too special, 
you sweet thang you. 
I got you a gift, 
without taste nor odor, 
more useful than diamonds.... 
IT'S A NEW TROLL'N MOTOR!!!

From the Birmingham Sunday Mercury (7th Jan DECNUMERIC 
Worker dead at desk for DATENUMERIC days 
Bosses of a publishing DATENUMERIC firm are trying to work out why no one 
noticed that one of their employees had been sitting dead at 
his desk for FIVE DAYS before anyone asked if he was feeling 
okay. DATENUMERIC George Turklebaum, INTNUMERIC who had been employed as a 
proof-reader at a New York firm for DATENUMERIC years, had a heart attack 
in the open-plan office he shared with DATENUMERIC other workers. DATENUMERIC He 
quietly passed away on Monday, but nobody noticed until 
Saturday morning when an office cleaner DATENUMERIC asked why he was 
still working during the weekend. DATENUMERIC His boss Elliot Wachiaski 
said "George was always the first guy in each morning and the 
last to leave at night, so no one found it unusual that he was in 
the same position all that time and didn't say anything. DATENUMERIC He was 
always absorbed in his work and kept much to himself. DATENUMERIC "A post 
mortem examination revealed that he had been dead for five 
days after suffering a coronary. DATENUMERIC Ironically, George was 
proofreading manuscripts of medical textbooks when he died. 
You may want to give your co-workers a nudge or kick 
occasionally. 
Hey are you still breathing?

I met with Jeff Kiester of DTI yesterday regarding the storage offering they 
have on the market. DATENUMERIC They have DATENUMERIC Bcf storage capacity and 30,000dt/d of 
FT-GSS up for bid by DATENUMERIC However there will be up to an additional DATENUMERIC 
Bcf of storage capcity available before DATENUMERIC depending on additional 
turnback. DATENUMERIC All of this capacity is utility turnback mainly, East Ohio, 
National Fuel and RG&E. 
Potential uses for DTI storage: 
DATENUMERIC DATENUMERIC Desk use DATENUMERIC If we buy the storage without the transportation we would 
inject and withdraw at SP. DATENUMERIC If we do submit a bid, I would recommend that we 
try to incorporate free intramonth injection capability, effectivly giving us 
a no-notice type service that we could use to take physical positions in the 
cash market. DATENUMERIC The current park/loan rate is DECNUMERIC /dt/d, it seems we utilize 
this DATENUMERIC times a month. 
DATENUMERIC DATENUMERIC VNG DATENUMERIC AGL could want to look into adding storage to the VNG portfolio, 
the drawback is that the PL1 line has no excess deliverability, VNG's need is 
more a peak day issue. 
DATENUMERIC DATENUMERIC Partner with EES DATENUMERIC Paul Tate from EES also sat in on our meeting, he 
expressed an interest in looking into potential partnering oppourtunities 
with the East desk regarding markets on TCO and DTI. DATENUMERIC This storage offering 
for example could be something we partner on. DATENUMERIC I plan to meet with Paul at 
the beggining of next week to discuss further (Dick I will check with you on 
your availability). 
Jeff also indicated there will be more transportation capacity turned back in 
the near future. DATENUMERIC There will be a posting for INTNUMERIC dt/d of Lebanon DATENUMERIC Leidy 
capacity coming out in the next few weeks. 
Market view on capacity release: 
With the utilities turning back transportation, the economics of the capacity 
release market will change. DATENUMERIC The utilities have historically released 
transportation in the summer months for DECNUMERIC or less (as low as DECNUMERIC in 
order to recover something from their asset. DATENUMERIC DTI will now be the marketer of 
the turned back capacity. DATENUMERIC Historically the pipeline has been very reluctant 
to sell capacity below max rate in the winter and less than DECNUMERIC DECNUMERIC at 
current rates) in the summer. DATENUMERIC DATENUMERIC Jeff indicated that his view is that capacity 
values will increase slighly this summer and significantly next summer due to 
the new power gen load coming online DATENUMERIC DATENUMERIC As part of DTI's last rate case 
settlement FT-GSS holders can no longer release transportation in the summer, 
that went into effect last summer-00. DATENUMERIC Although the capacity release market 
was a little tighter last summer it did not significantly drive up capacity 
release prices in the summer-00. DATENUMERIC My view is that two of the three power gen 
loads will be interuptible and therfore will not sigificantly increase the 
overall load factor of the system. DATENUMERIC The bottom line is that DTI is competing 
with capacity release and I feel there will be enough capacity release 
available on the market this summer to force DTI to sell it's capacity below 
DECNUMERIC of max rate. DATENUMERIC However capacity release prices may increase next year as 
more utilities turnback capacity and the new power generation may be in the 
capacity release market. 
Market View on Basis on CNG for Summer DATENUMERIC & Summer DATENUMERIC 
With the increased load and potentially low storage inventory level going 
into this summer, basis could be strong vs historical prices. However, with 
the inception of M&NEP delivering 400,000dt/d into the Northeast last year 
CNG basis (summer strip) was less than DECNUMERIC in Jan-00 and Feb-00, DATENUMERIC even 
though the April DATENUMERIC storage inventory level was the lowest since DATENUMERIC DATENUMERIC In 
DATENUMERIC CNG Apr-Oct strip traded as high as high as DECNUMERIC in Feb-96 and dropped 
as low as DECNUMERIC by May-96. DATENUMERIC DTI summer load is averages DATENUMERIC DATENUMERIC DATENUMERIC Bcf, I 
don't think the 100,000dt/d load of the new power gen load will be 
significant this summer considering the additional supply coming in from 
Dracut. DATENUMERIC DATENUMERIC However with American National Power Inc (34,000Dth/d) and El Paso 
Gas Services Co (139,000dt/d) both coming online in INTNUMERIC that have 
contracted for around half of the Dracut supply, this may cause sumer basis 
prices to increase from current levels (Apr-01-Oct-01 strip DECNUMERIC this 
summer and depending on storage inventories 4/1/02, DATENUMERIC Apr-Oct-02 basis may be 
also get stronger.

RE: DATENUMERIC HIGH BTU LEVEL ON THE LAROSA LATERAL 
Tennessee is encountering high BTU levels on the Larosa Lateral. DATENUMERIC These high 
levels have been the subject of customer complaints that the delivered gas 
is interfering with the proper operation of various lines, regulators, 
meters and appliances located on the Larosa Lateral. DATENUMERIC Beginning, with the 
January DATENUMERIC Gas Day, Tennessee requests point operators of receipt meters 
located on the Larosa Lateral to tender to Tennessee gas that meets the gas 
quality specifications found in the General Terms and Conditions of the 
Tennessee Gas Tariff. 
The following is a list of receipt meters located on the Larosa Lateral: 
DATENUMERIC DATENUMERIC Red Fish Bay Transport 
Absent resolution of the problems, beginning with the January DATENUMERIC Gas Day, 
Tennessee will not accept nominations from meters on the Larosa Lateral 
tendering out of specification gas and will issue an Operational Flow Order 
Balancing Alert to the point operator. 
If you have any questions, please contact your Account Representative or 
Volume Analyst. 
Craig Harris, Manager 
Operations Control

Tennessee is finalizing their CanEast project which will scoop the 
Independence Pipeline effort and allow Tennessee to deliver INTNUMERIC Dthd into 
Leidy beginning in DATENUMERIC at the same time the first phase of Transco's 
MarketLink begins. DATENUMERIC The first phase of MarketLink has a capacity of INTNUMERIC 
Dthd and the second phase is scheduled to begin DATENUMERIC with an additional 
INTNUMERIC Dthd. DATENUMERIC Tennessee was the successful bidder on a recent open season 
that National Fuel had for INTNUMERIC Dthd of space between Niagara and Leidy. 
Tennessee has executed a DATENUMERIC year lease for the space. DATENUMERIC They will use this 
capacity and a DATENUMERIC year lease arrangement that they are finalizing with 
Dominion Transmission for Ellisburg to Leidy capacity to form the basis of 
their CanEast Project. DATENUMERIC The Dominion lease will allow Tennessee to use 
unsubscribed Zone L to Zone DATENUMERIC capacity and deliver approximately INTNUMERIC Dthd 
from the Gulf Coast to Leidy. DATENUMERIC (Dynegy negotiated an index-based, revenue 
sharing contract with Tennessee for delivery into Dominion using this 
negotiating with shippers to subscribe to the CanEast capacity. DATENUMERIC They are 
willing to negotiate contracts less than ten years and have negotiated terms 
that synch up with the second phase of MarketLink. DATENUMERIC This should allow 
available capacity from the Gulf Coast or Niagara to Leidy or secondary 
delivery points such as Dominion (since Phase I of MarketLink is set) for one 
year contracts.

from Venice DATENUMERIC DATENUMERIC DATENUMERIC DATENUMERIC DATENUMERIC demand charge 
from the Mobile Bay pooling point on Koch DATENUMERIC demand charge 
(if we buy upstream of the pooling point then we would also pay a DATENUMERIC 
gathering fee on Mobile Bay) 
In addition we will be charged DATENUMERIC ACA from any of these receipt points. 
The fuel rate is DECNUMERIC DATENUMERIC This will be passed on to Ormet. 
Koch has agreed that any volumes in excess of the 15/d of FT will be at the 
same discounted rate, but will flow on an IT basis. DATENUMERIC If this IT is cut, we 
still must use best efforts to transport from other receipt points on Koch or 
on Cypress. DATENUMERIC Ormet pays all additional transport costs. 
Additionally, we have a price re-opener if Koch changes from monthly 
balancing at any point during the contract term. 
I am working with Koch to get secondary delivery points on Koch in the event 
that the desk wants to take the gas elsewhere (i.e. if Ormet doesn't need the 
gas or if you choose to deliver off of Cypress). DATENUMERIC If you have any preferences 
for alternate delivery points, please let me know.

Media Inquiries: Chris Stockton 
Re: DATENUMERIC DATENUMERIC DATENUMERIC DATENUMERIC System Imbalance Notice 
Please be advised that Transco has been experiencing excessive negative 
transportation imbalances (deliveries in excess of receipts) on its 
system over the past several days. DATENUMERIC As of December INTNUMERIC INTNUMERIC Shippers 
are advised to avoid any additional negative imbalances as soon as 
Additionally, until further notice, Transco will institute more 
restrictive practices at its pooling points. DATENUMERIC Transco will reduce the DECNUMERIC 
tolerance currently allowed at its pooling points to DECNUMERIC or INTNUMERIC dts for 
Shippers with negatively scheduled imbalances (i.e. deliveries into the 
pools are less than receipts away from the pools). DATENUMERIC Shippers with 
positively scheduled imbalances at their pools will continue to be held 
to the DECNUMERIC tolerance levels. DATENUMERIC Transco will not enforce these pool 
imbalance tolerances during the timely nomination cycle; however, 
Shippers are expected to balance their pools to the limits identified 
above by the ID2 nomination cycle. DATENUMERIC Transco may proactively decrease 
markets to bring them in line with supplies at pooling points. 
Absent voluntary compliance with this notice, Transco may be required to 
use any remedies available, up to and including reliance upon Section DATENUMERIC 
of the General Terms and Conditions of Transco's FERC Gas Tariff, to 
ensure it retains the appropriate level of operational flexibility. 
If you have any questions, please call Terry Fitch at DECNUMERIC DATENUMERIC or 
Terry C. Fitch

RE: DATENUMERIC DATENUMERIC DATENUMERIC DATENUMERIC DATENUMERIC Winter Operations and 1Line Meetings 
You are cordially invited to attend one of Transco's three regionally 
scheduled DATENUMERIC Winter Operations and 1Line meetings. 
The meetings are scheduled as follows: 
Gateway Hotel 
Charlotte Hotel 
This year's Winter Operations Meetings have been expanded to include a 
variety of material that will be of interest to all customers. The meetings 
will focus on three specific areas: DATENUMERIC DECNUMERIC the traditional update on 
operational plans for the winter, maintenance outages planned for next year 
and a customer service update; DECNUMERIC a 1Line update and discussion on business 
practice changes that will require tariff changes; and DECNUMERIC a review and 
discussion of the EDI and flat file datasets for nominations, confirmations 
and schedule quantity reports targeted at those customers and their 
information technology staff who have expressed an interest in this 
information. DATENUMERIC Transco will also be holding a pre-filing meeting in 
DC specifically to address the tariff changes associated with implementation 
of the 1Line system. DATENUMERIC That meeting will be held in mid-November and 
will be notified as to time and location in the near future. 
The meetings in Newark and Charlotte will start at DATENUMERIC a.m. and end at 
approximately DATENUMERIC p.m. DATENUMERIC Coffee, juice and pastries will be provided before 
the meeting and lunch will be served at approximately DATENUMERIC a.m. DATENUMERIC The 
meeting will start at DATENUMERIC p.m. and end at approximately DATENUMERIC p.m. 
Refreshments will be provided mid-afternoon. 
The agenda for the Newark and Charlotte meetings as well as the Houston 
meeting is included below. DATENUMERIC Please note that the agenda for the Houston 
meeting is significantly different than the other meetings. 
that we can have an accurate count for each meeting.

A Service Verification is a statement created in the Settlements module of 
Unify. DATENUMERIC The Volume Management group uses this statement to approve a payment 
to a pipeline for a transportation related expense. DATENUMERIC The Service Verification 
shows an amount calculated on quantities for a contract in Path Manager, 
times a rate from DATENUMERIC either the Unify Tables or a rate on the Sitara deal 
ticket. DATENUMERIC I could put a zero rate on the Sitara deal ticket to zero the 
unnecessary expense out but this doesn't resolve the issue. DATENUMERIC Since we are 
noming agent only, we don't want something coming across the system for 
calculation of a payment. DATENUMERIC Is there a different way to handle these types of 
contracts when they are being entered in Path Manager? DATENUMERIC I've heard of 
something like a point nom as way to handle. DATENUMERIC Are we doing that on this 
Brenda, Please explain......What's a service verification and how can we fix

Re: Transco Files a Motion for Modification of Settlement to 
??? Permit Interim Partial Refunds 
In response to certain customers' requests, Transco submits a 
Motion for Modification of Settlement to Permit Interim Partial 
Refunds in the above-captioned proceedings. By this motion, 
Transco requests that the Commission modify Article V of the 
January INTNUMERIC DATENUMERIC Stipulation and Agreement to permit Transco to 
make an interim partial refund of amount to Non-Contesting 
Parties, if any, related to the Capital Structure/Rate of Return 
Issues on or about October INTNUMERIC DATENUMERIC The refund is being made to 
parties in advance of the date that such refunds are due as set 
forth in the Stipulation and Agreement, in part to help mitigate 
the effects of current high natural gas prices on their 
customers. For further detailed information of the Motion filed 
at the Federal Energy Regulatory Commission, please refer to 
Transco's filing today in the above mentioned dockets. 
Specifically, Transco proposes to make interim partial refunds on 
or about October INTNUMERIC to Non-Contesting Parties related to the 
Capital Structure/Rate of Return Issues. Transco will refund to 
those customers with interest from the date of payment to the 
date of refund, the amount, if any, collected from May INTNUMERIC DATENUMERIC 
through February INTNUMERIC in excess of the amount that would have 
been collected under the Settlement Rates as adjusted by the 
Commission's findings in its March INTNUMERIC DATENUMERIC order in Docket No. 
RP97-71-000 on the Capital Structure/Rate of Return Issues, 
subject to the "refund floor". These interim partial refunds will 
be made on a lump sum basis, and will not be accompanied by any 
supporting documentation. However, supporting documentation for 
the principal and the interest calculation will be available upon 
If a Non-Contesting Party does not wish to receive an interim 
partial refund, and wishes instead to await issuance of a final 
Commission order no longer subject to rehearing on the Capital 
Structure/Rate of Return issues prior to receiving any refunds 
related to those issues, Transco requests that such Non- 
Contesting Party notify its customer service representative, on 
or before October INTNUMERIC INTNUMERIC of its election not to participate in 
the interim partial refunds. 
Manager of Rate and Tariff Implementation

Gas) filed revised tariff sheets in Docket No. RP00-518-000 
to change the Effective Fuel Retention Percentage (EFRP) 
under its Rate Schedule FT which Transco utilizes to render 
service to its customers under its Rate Schedule FT-NT. 
Texas Gas has proposed to change its EFRP from DECNUMERIC to 
DECNUMERIC for the Winter Season (November DATENUMERIC March) and from 
DECNUMERIC to DECNUMERIC for the Summer Season (April DATENUMERIC October). If 
accepted as proposed, the revised Texas Gas fuel percentages 
would result in the following changes in Transco's current 
Rate Schedule FT-NT Fuel Percentages effective November INTNUMERIC 
Winter Season DATENUMERIC DECNUMERIC decrease 
Summer Season DATENUMERIC DECNUMERIC increase

As you know, technology is critical to Enron; it drives our success and wil= 
continue to do so in the future. Technology has helped Enron create new=20 
businesses like Enron Broadband Services and Enron Net Works, and it is=20 
responsible for applications such as EnronOnline and EnronCredit.com. DATENUMERIC You= 
seen what technology can do at work. DATENUMERIC Now we want you and your family to=20 
realize its benefits at home. 
With that in mind, we are excited to let you know that we are introducing t= 
ClickAtHome 
program, which will give each employee a computer for use at home. Where=20 
technology permits, we will also subsidize an Internet connection. With the= 
click of a mouse, a home computer plus Internet access will put a world of= 
Internet knowledge at your family=01,s fingertips. DECNUMERIC 
We have just signed an agreement with Dell Computer Corporation to provide= 
the computer hardware. We wanted to let you know about the program now in= 
case you and your family were considering the purchase or upgrade of a home= 
computer or Internet connection in the next few months. The scope of=20 
ClickAtHome includes the following: 
? Basic package: Dell desktop computer with a high-speed processor, floppy= 
disk drive, mouse, speakers, monitor, modem, CD-ROM drive and Windows DECNUMERIC 
software. Employees will have the option to receive a subsidized Internet= 
connection, including broadband, where commercially available. 
? Participation: This program will be available to active regular full-time= 
and regular part-time employees of Enron and its wholly owned subsidiaries;= 
however, employees of some Enron companies (Portland General Electric, EOTT= 
Enron Facility Services) may not be able to participate due to legal,=20 
accounting, tax, labor or business reasons. DATENUMERIC Eligibility includes being=20 
employed at the time of implementation. DECNUMERIC 
? Timing: U.S. employee sign-up will begin in early INTNUMERIC with delivery of= 
the equipment and Internet connection to follow shortly thereafter. DATENUMERIC Delive= 
of equipment to participating non-U.S. employees is targeted for late DATENUMERIC 
Details about this program are still being finalized. DATENUMERIC To address some of= 
your initial questions, we=01,ve posted a question-and-answer document on= 
future where you will have an opportunity to ask questions. Or, you can=20 
We are excited to extend our investment in technology to you and your=20 
family. DATENUMERIC We believe this program takes communication at Enron to a new leve= 
by creating endless possibilities for you to experience and participate in= 
the broadband Internet revolution. It is just another reason why we believe= 
Enron is a great place to work.

Updated CES August FOM volumes 
The attached file contains our daily volume requirements for 8/1and DATENUMERIC the 
following day(s) as listed DATENUMERIC DATENUMERIC DATENUMERIC DATENUMERIC There are three DATENUMERIC worksheets labelled as 
'Total Reqs': DATENUMERIC Contains the volumes that CES is requesting from Enron at each 
of the delivery points and dates indicated in the columns labelled "NOM". 
Enron schedulers will want to check this sheet to see how much gas is needed 
a specific point. DATENUMERIC DATENUMERIC The AGL volumes are not timely and should be ignored until 
further notice. DATENUMERIC DATENUMERIC DATENUMERIC CES schedulers note: DATENUMERIC the attached file is archived on 
P:\Energy Ops\Enron\May_00\Daily\ *.xls, so you don't have to save a duplicate 
copy elsewhere on the network. 
'Daily Change' DATENUMERIC DATENUMERIC shows the change (increase +/decrease DECNUMERIC in the daily volume 
needed from Enron at the designated citygate delivery point relative to the 
supply volumes arranged previously with Enron prior to the current date. DATENUMERIC For 
the current gas day, the change is an intra-day change and is calculated using 
the previous day's volume request for the current day (e.g., If the current 
fact effectuated). DATENUMERIC For tomorrow's gas day and any subsequent ones shown, the 
change is computed as the latest Dth Nomination requirement less the 
First-of-the-month supply volume plus or minus any adjustments made since the 
first-of-the-month to the FOM supply for the (future) days shown. DATENUMERIC (e.g., If 
today is 3/28, then the change for 3/29, 3/30, etc. is computed with respect 
the first-of-the-month volumes for those days adjusted for any additional 
purchases or sell-backs since the first-of-the-month thru 3/27.) DATENUMERIC DATENUMERIC This sheet 
should be useful in determining prices for daily changes in gas volumes that 
take or turn back. DATENUMERIC DATENUMERIC The column labelled "ENA Daily Swing +/- vs FOM volume' 
shows the absolute magnitude of the daily swings allowed by ENA at 
pre-specified prices. DATENUMERIC Prices for Swing volumes exceeding these magnitudes or 
for swings at delivery points without pre-specified pricing must be 
negotiated. 
'Comments': DATENUMERIC DATENUMERIC Contains comments on selected items on various days. 
Hans Herzog

deals in the "External Column" do not show up in our P&L.

double dip the reimbursements for transport demand charges if I show 
reimbursements on the transport sheet and we include the reimbursements on 
the Physical Forward sale as well.

As noted in the Order DATENUMERIC summary you received a couple of weeks ago, 
Iroquois Gas is proposing to limit overlapping nominations on segmented 
capacity. DATENUMERIC Shippers will only be able to overlap segments to the extent the 
overlapped segment is within the path of both the releasing and replacement 
shipper. DATENUMERIC Iroquois has made a number of arguments (some persuasive, some not) 
about why any other procedure is operationally infeasible. DATENUMERIC For instance, 
they state that they would have to eliminate umbrella accounts because the 
process of reviewing contracts for interrelated releases would be too lengthy 
to complete within GISB timelines. 
Is this issue of major concern to any of you in transacting daily business on 
Iroquois' system? DATENUMERIC Have we tried to do any segmenting outside of the paths? 
Please give me a call at X.35840 by Friday morning if we should file comments 
on this issue. DATENUMERIC I did not see anything else of significance in their filing.
