Transcontinental Gas Pipe Line System (Transco) 
RE: Modifications to Capacity Release Processes and Segmentation 
and Order DATENUMERIC Compliance filings 
On June INTNUMERIC DATENUMERIC Transco made a compliance filing with the Federal 
Energy Regulatory Commission (FERC), in Docket No. RP00-17-000. 
This filing proposed several changes to the Capacity Release and 
capacity segmentation procedures that are to become effective for 
business beginning gas day September INTNUMERIC DATENUMERIC DATENUMERIC A customer meeting 
will be held in Washington DC on August INTNUMERIC DATENUMERIC at DATENUMERIC a.m. 
(please see the Transit posting dated July INTNUMERIC DECNUMERIC and in Houston 
on August DATENUMERIC INTNUMERIC DATENUMERIC at the Williams Tower, Level INTNUMERIC Dining Room C 
at DATENUMERIC p.m. DATENUMERIC The Houston meeting will address both the segmentation 
changes and highlights of Transco's Order 637/637A Compliance filing, 
with segmentation being discussed from DATENUMERIC p.m. DATENUMERIC DATENUMERIC p.m. and the 
Order DATENUMERIC discussed from DATENUMERIC p.m. DATENUMERIC DATENUMERIC p.m. DATENUMERIC In order to finalize 
the appropriate arrangements for the meeting, Transco requests 
There are two key elements to the proposed changes 
DATENUMERIC DATENUMERIC Use of "Master" FT-R Commodity Contracts 
Transco will no longer use the "Master" Commodity Form of Service 
Agreement for reservation rate capacity releases. DATENUMERIC Historically, 
Transco has required capacity release shippers to execute two FT-R 
contracts upon their initial acquisition of released capacity: 
the FT-R Demand contract and the FT-R "Master" Commodity contract. 
With subsequent reservation rate releases, shippers were only 
required to execute new FT-R Demand contracts. DATENUMERIC Each FT-R Demand 
contract was specific to a capacity release deal and the FT-R 
"Master" Commodity contract was used for all nomination and 
commodity billing purposes. 
Effective with business for gas day September INTNUMERIC INTNUMERIC Transco will 
require shippers acquiring capacity through reservation rate 
capacity releases to execute and nominate transportation on each 
new FT-R Demand contract. DATENUMERIC This will require new activities to be 
created for each capacity release contract. DATENUMERIC For any capacity release 
deals that span the August DATENUMERIC DATENUMERIC September DATENUMERIC period, nominations for 
gas day August INTNUMERIC DATENUMERIC will be on the existing "Master" Commodity 
contract and nominations for gas day September INTNUMERIC DATENUMERIC will be new 
transactions on the FT-R Demand contract. DATENUMERIC Additionally, all 
commodity billing will be done on the FT-R Demand contract. 
Transco will send a "Notice of Termination" to all FT-R "Master" 
Commodity contract holders identifying the contract that will 
terminate as well as a list of all of the FT-R Demand contracts 
that will continue to be effective in September. 
DATENUMERIC Limiting nominations within a segment 
Consistent with FERC's ruling in this docket and consistent with 
similar rulings on Tennessee and Texas Gas, Transco will limit the 
quantity of gas that can be scheduled DATENUMERIC IN ANY SEGMENT of the 
pipeline to the original firm contracted capacity. 
Transco will aggregate all nominations under an original FT 
contract and any related capacity release contracts 
(or subsequent re-releases) to ensure that the total scheduled 
quantity for the family of contracts is within the original 
contractual entitlement. DATENUMERIC If nominations for the family of 
contracts exceed the original entitlement, nominations using 
any secondary capacity rights will be considered as secondary 
nominations and subject to cut on a pro-rata basis. 
As stated above, Transco intends to implement these changes for gas 
day September INTNUMERIC DATENUMERIC DATENUMERIC In the event systematic changes cannot be 
completed or the FERC directs Transco to modify its planned 
implementation, Transco will notify customers via TRANSIT of any 
business practice changes as well as the expected implementation 
If you have any questions concerning these changes, please contact 
your Customer Services Representative or Scheduling Analyst. 
Segmentation And Order DATENUMERIC DATENUMERIC Houston Meeting

Effective immediately we are changing the way we handle deliveries to 
Oglethorpe on Transco. 
Current Process 
ENA sales gas to Oglethorpe at St DATENUMERIC 
ENA buys gas from EPMI (deal DECNUMERIC at St DATENUMERIC at Gas Daily 
ENA sells gas back to EPMI at Doyle Plant at Gas Daily plus variable cost. 
New Process 
ENA sells gas to Oglethorpe at St DATENUMERIC (deal INTNUMERIC baseload deal DATENUMERIC and deal 
ENA does an exchange buy (deal DECNUMERIC at St DATENUMERIC DATENUMERIC Curretly, this volume will 
match the sale to Oglethorpe at St DATENUMERIC 
ENA does an exchange sell (deal DECNUMERIC volume on this deal will be the 
amount on deal DATENUMERIC less Z4 to Z4 fuel.

We have a new Park & Loan DATENUMERIC Storage deal on National Fuel effective 
to our brand new firm storage contract. DATENUMERIC We are now long FSS and short PALS. 
We have the rights to withdraw on a firm basis up to INTNUMERIC dth per day. 
However, we need to call and get permission to withdraw more than INTNUMERIC dth 
on any given day. DATENUMERIC Also, the withdrawal takes place at an interconnect, like 
Trco-Leidy. DATENUMERIC We do not have to ship the gas on Nat Fuel. 
We give Nat Fuel the gas back on an IT basis via our IAS agreement (Nat Fuel 
is still setting up the contracts). DATENUMERIC We can give Nat Fuel the gas back at any 
point we wish. DATENUMERIC We do not have to pay back the gas at the same point we 
withdraw on the FSS. DATENUMERIC And we can pay back the gas before we withdraw it. 
What we will probably do most of the time is take the FSS into Trco at Leidy 
and payback the IAS agreement at Niagara and Leidy. DATENUMERIC ENA will pay Nat Fuel 
and August. DATENUMERIC This deal is over on Aug 31st. DATENUMERIC I just entered the demand charge 
on my Market East demand charge sheet. DATENUMERIC I do not have any deals set up in 
Sitara. DATENUMERIC I need to see the contracts from Nat Fuel first. DATENUMERIC I will keep track 
of the balances on an Excel worksheet. DATENUMERIC All commodity cost and fuel is 
capured in the DECNUMERIC demand charge. DATENUMERIC Beavy and I will make sure the payback 
and withdrawal tickets are balanced in Sitara once we start flowing gas on 
this deal. DATENUMERIC If we payback INTNUMERIC dth next week and we do not have any 
withdrawals, then I will show a INTNUMERIC dth withdrawal on DATENUMERIC just to 
keep the tickets balanced.

We have a new Park & Loan DATENUMERIC Storage deal on National Fuel effective 
to our brand new firm storage contract. DATENUMERIC We are now long FSS and short PALS. 
We have the rights to withdraw on a firm basis up to INTNUMERIC dth per day. 
However, we need to call and get permission to withdraw more than INTNUMERIC dth 
on any given day. DATENUMERIC Also, the withdrawal takes place at an interconnect, like 
Trco-Leidy. DATENUMERIC We do not have to ship the gas on Nat Fuel. 
We give Nat Fuel the gas back on an IT basis via our IAS agreement (Nat Fuel 
is still setting up the contracts). DATENUMERIC We can give Nat Fuel the gas back at any 
point we wish. DATENUMERIC We do not have to pay back the gas at the same point we 
withdraw on the FSS. DATENUMERIC And we can pay back the gas before we withdraw it. 
What we will probably do most of the time is take the FSS into Trco at Leidy 
and payback the IAS agreement at Niagara and Leidy. DATENUMERIC ENA will pay Nat Fuel 
and August. DATENUMERIC This deal is over on Aug 31st. DATENUMERIC I just entered the demand charge 
on my Market East demand charge sheet. DATENUMERIC I do not have any deals set up in 
Sitara. DATENUMERIC I need to see the contracts from Nat Fuel first. DATENUMERIC I will keep track 
of the balances on an Excel worksheet. DATENUMERIC All commodity cost and fuel is 
capured in the DECNUMERIC demand charge. DATENUMERIC Beavy and I will make sure the payback 
and withdrawal tickets are balanced in Sitara once we start flowing gas on 
this deal. DATENUMERIC If we payback INTNUMERIC dth next week and we do not have any 
withdrawals, then I will show a INTNUMERIC dth withdrawal on DATENUMERIC just to 
keep the tickets balanced. 
Payback Techniques 
Under the expert eye of the wonderfull, superfantastic, all-around great guy, 
Dick Jenkins, I've come up with some options on paying back the gas. 
Niagara DATENUMERIC only works when Niagara is open. DATENUMERIC Nat Fuel has been very close to 
capacity this week. DATENUMERIC However, we should always see what Martin can do with 
the gas if it gets backed up into TCPL. DATENUMERIC OR if Niagara is constrained, we can 
ship the gas on our firm Nat Fuel contract then pay it back to Nat Fuel, at 
today's prices that cost about DECNUMERIC

assuming we get to roll over all of our CNG fuel waivers.

Hi team. DATENUMERIC Do not discuss this with anyone at CES or EES please. DATENUMERIC May not be a 
problem but just in case. 
New Power Company is current working on the acquisition of CES' mass market 
customers. DATENUMERIC In light of the acquisition, there are issues that surround our 
relationship with ENA as we step into the supply management agreement. DATENUMERIC Below 
are the observations DATENUMERIC that I have. DATENUMERIC I would like to get you feedback on 
these. DATENUMERIC If necessary, let's get together to discuss the ramifications. 
DECNUMERIC We are purchasing customers within only twelve markets. DATENUMERIC As such, we will 
only interpret the language of the agreement related to "existing markets" as 
applying to only those twelve markets. DATENUMERIC For other markets that we conduct 
business in, we would choose to make a decision on supplier and load 
management even if it is an LDC identified as an existing market under the 
agreement. DATENUMERIC In essence, we see the supply management agreement being 
bi-furcated since CES is selling C&I to another marketer. 
DECNUMERIC My interpretation is that New Power Company will only be on the hook for 
capacity and storage charges as they apply to mass markets. DATENUMERIC This would 
include capacity and/or storage allocations received on CVA, CMD, AGL. DATENUMERIC In 
addition, it would include the FSS and SST purchased on COH. DATENUMERIC It would also 
mass markets. DATENUMERIC It is our contention that we will only be on the hook for the 
demand charges related to the capacity covering mass market purchase 
commitments identified in the schedules of the purchase agreement DATENUMERIC DATENUMERIC All 
un-utilized capacity would to stay with CES and/or buyer of the C&I 
agreements. 
DECNUMERIC We need to discuss the application of the contract to additional capacity 
that New Power procures applicable to the periods prior to Apr. INTNUMERIC DATENUMERIC DATENUMERIC I 
want to keep this capacity separate and under our control. DATENUMERIC I will need your 
viewpoint on this. DATENUMERIC If ENA feels strongly that we must place the capacity 
under the supply management agreement, then I would want to discuss our 
ability to market any excess capacity in open market. DATENUMERIC Bottom-line, I want to 
avoid gas costs being inflated due to my inability to receive value for 
un-utilized capacity. 
DECNUMERIC I would like to get your viewpoint on the right of first refusal clause. 
My view would be that its applicable would be made to transactions of similar 
nature and service level. (supply management) DATENUMERIC To the degree that New Power 
chose after the primary term to manage its supply, all supply only 
transactions would not be subject to this clause. 
I know you will need to review the contract. DATENUMERIC We have some time to discuss 
these issues, but would like to have feedback from you no later than next 
Friday, if at all possible. DATENUMERIC I can be reached at ext DATENUMERIC DATENUMERIC Thanks for your 
CES Supply Management Agreement

deals. DATENUMERIC However, Boston should recall all this capacity effective DATENUMERIC

Its good we didn't book anything because CES just sold a lot of their 
customers to another company. 
I definatley think we should book these volumes for all of your reasons below 
plus each month we don't seem to have a decent estimate until the 30th or 
Here is your problem in getting these booked. DATENUMERIC You can do what you want, but 
I still think we should book it. DATENUMERIC The flexibility in takes is only DECNUMERIC so 
your flash to actual will not be that great--certainly less than if you don't 
book anything. DATENUMERIC Plus, at least if we book something it will be easier to tell 
if they do not take the volumes they are supposed to. DATENUMERIC In addition, per our 
discussion with Retail--which Dick was in on that meeting--it is unlikely 
that the sale of the CES-Retail business would occur before September or 
October, which in my mind means it may not be til the end of the year. DATENUMERIC This 
would pretty much get us to the end of the deal term. DATENUMERIC And finally, what if 
Chris and/or Dick is gone at some point in time--we need the volume info in 
Obviously it is just my recommendation to book it---you can do what you 
I talked to Chris and Dick about the issue that the CES index positions are 
not reflected in the books. DATENUMERIC Chris was concerned about what (firm) volume to 
book since there is flexibility in the takes. DATENUMERIC Also, he said he has a strong 
feeling that CES-Retail may go away in the near future so why book it. DATENUMERIC Dick 
agreed that maybe we should not book anything on this right now. DATENUMERIC So Chris 
said he will look into this issue early next week and get with me.

There are five CNG postings listed below. 
APPALACHIAN PRODUCER NOTICE 
Dear West Virginia Producer, 
Over the last several years, Dominion Transmission has worked hard providing 
additional value to producers on its gathering system and through innovative 
projects and joint ventures. DATENUMERIC In continuing with that process to bring you 
more value for your local production and to improve the efficiency of our 
gathering system, we would like to continue a process where compression 
into our gathering system may be approved. DATENUMERIC We have been able to grant a 
limited number of these requests in the past, and would now like to make 
this opportunity somewhat more widely available to the producers. 
For this second offering, the process we will use is as follows: DATENUMERIC For a 
period of DATENUMERIC days, beginning DATENUMERIC Noon on May INTNUMERIC INTNUMERIC the Gathering and 
Production Division of Dominion Transmission will accept applications for 
compression rights into its gathering system for gas feeding its SCHUTTE 
compressor station. DATENUMERIC The Dominion "bubbles" affected are DATENUMERIC & DATENUMERIC 
Dominion recognizes that, although limited, there does exist the incremental 
capacity for throughput through these compressor stations. DATENUMERIC The incremental 
capacity authorized through new compression agreements will not exceed the 
limit Dominion determines to be the capacity of the existing compressors. 
Dominion will attempt to be flexible in approving the applications it 
receives, but will limit approved applications so as to not unreasonably 
interfere with the production from the existing non-compressed gas entering 
the system. DATENUMERIC Please submit your written application to Joe Thompson at the 
Dominion Gathering & Production Office. DATENUMERIC The application must indicate the 
amount of "incremental" gas for the specific compression agreement. 
Dominion recognizes that the installation of compression requires differing 
time frames. DATENUMERIC We will balance that consideration with our need to insure 
that the application process is not abused to the disadvantage of other 
producers; therefore, once granted, the applicant must have the compression 
in place and operable within six months of Dominion's approval, or the rights 
to all unconstructed capacity will be forfeited. DATENUMERIC In the event that more 
requests for compression rights for incremental gas are received than for 
which there is capacity, Dominion will award the rights on a prorated basis. 
Please include in your written request the mid number or a map of the 
location where you will be requesting to install compression. DATENUMERIC Also include 
the incremental volume you are wishing to transport under the compression 
agreement. DATENUMERIC Your name, company name and address, state of incorporation, 
phone and fax number, as well as an e-mail address, if available, should 
be included (please print or type). 
Forward this information to: 
Joseph A. Thompson 
Manager, Business Development 
Dominion Transmission 
Gathering & Production Division 
DATENUMERIC Davisson Run Road 
After all requests are received, we will review the request and make a 
determination on granting compression based on capacity available and the 
capacity requests. DATENUMERIC You will be contacted as soon as possible after 
June INTNUMERIC DATENUMERIC to notify you of those requests that have been approved. 
Please realize that this is a "window" and the opportunity will close 
I hope that this will provide opportunity for you to increase the value 
of your production facilities, and I look forward to working with you on 
this opportunity to add compression. DATENUMERIC You can contact Joe Thompson at 
have regarding this compression DATENUMERIC "open season" request on Dominion Gathering. 
H. Dale Rexrode 
Director, Producer Services & Business Development 
APPALACHIAN PRODUCER NOTICE 
Dear West Virginia Producer, 
Over the last several years, Dominion Transmission has worked hard providing 
additional value to producers on its gathering system and through innovative 
projects and joint ventures. DATENUMERIC In continuing with that process to bring you 
more value for your local production and to improve the efficiency of our 
gathering system, we would like to continue a process where compression 
into our gathering system may be approved. DATENUMERIC We have been able to grant a 
limited number of these requests in the past, and would now like to make 
this opportunity somewhat more widely available to the producers. 
For this second offering, the process we will use is as follows: DATENUMERIC For a 
period of DATENUMERIC days, beginning DATENUMERIC Noon on May INTNUMERIC INTNUMERIC the Gathering and 
Production Division of Dominion Transmission will accept applications for 
compression rights into its gathering system for gas feeding its SMITHBURG, 
COLLINS, MAXWELL AND NEW OXFORD DATENUMERIC compressor stations. DATENUMERIC The Dominion "bubbles" 
affected are INTNUMERIC INTNUMERIC DATENUMERIC DATENUMERIC DATENUMERIC Dominion recognizes that, although very 
limited, there does exist the incremental capacity for throughput through 
these compressor stations. DATENUMERIC The incremental capacity authorized through new 
compression agreements will not exceed the limit Dominion determines to be 
the capacity of the existing compressors. DATENUMERIC Dominion will attempt to be 
in approving the applications it receives, but will limit approved 
applications 
so as to not unreasonably interfere with the production from the existing 
non-compressed gas entering the system. DATENUMERIC Please submit your written 
application 
to Joe Thompson at the Dominion Gathering & Production Office. DATENUMERIC The 
application 
must indicate the amount of "incremental" gas for the specific compression 
agreement. DATENUMERIC Dominion recognizes that the installation of compression requires 
differing time frames. DATENUMERIC We will balance that consideration with our need to 
insure that the application process is not abused to the disadvantage of 
producers; therefore, once granted, the applicant must have the compression 
place and operable within six months of Dominion's approval, or the rights to 
all unconstructed capacity will be forfeited. DATENUMERIC In the event that more 
for compression rights for incremental gas are received than for which there 
capacity, Dominion will award the rights on a prorated basis. 
Please include in your written request the mid number or a map of the 
location where you will be requesting to install compression. DATENUMERIC Also include 
incremental volume you are wishing to transport under the compression 
agreement. DATENUMERIC Your name, company name and address, state of incorporation, 
phone and fax number, as well as an e-mail address, if available, should be 
included (please print or type). 
Forward this information to: 
Joseph A. Thompson 
Manager, Business Development 
Dominion Transmission 
Gathering & Production Division 
DATENUMERIC Davisson Run Road 
After all requests are received, we will review the request and make a 
determination on granting compression based on capacity available and the 
capacity requests. DATENUMERIC You will be contacted as soon as possible after 
June INTNUMERIC DATENUMERIC to notify you of those requests that have been approved. 
Please realize that this is a "window" and the opportunity will close 
I hope that this will provide opportunity for you to increase the value of 
your production facilities, and I look forward to working with you on this 
opportunity to add compression. DATENUMERIC You can contact Joe Thompson at 
have regarding this compression DATENUMERIC "open season" request on Dominion Gathering. 
H. Dale Rexrode 
Director, Producer Services & Business

Dear West Virginia Producer, 
Over the last several years, Dominion Transmission has worked hard providing 
additional value to producers on its gathering system and 
through innovative projects and joint ventures. DATENUMERIC In continuing with 
that process to bring you more value for your local production and to 
improve the efficiency of our gathering system, we would like to continue a 
process where compression into our gathering system may be approved. 
We have been able to grant a limited number of these requests in the past, 
and would now like to make this opportunity somewhat more widely available to 
the producers. 
For this second offering, the process we will use is as follows: 
the Gathering and Production Division of Dominion Transmission will accept 
applications for compression rights into its gathering system for gas 
feeding the Barbour County High Pressure System. DATENUMERIC The Dominion "bubble" 
affected is DATENUMERIC DATENUMERIC DATENUMERIC Dominion recognizes that, although limited, there does 
exist the incremental capacity for throughput through these compressor 
The incremental capacity authorized through new compression agreements 
will not exceed the limit Dominion determines to be the capacity of the 
pipeline system. DATENUMERIC Dominion will attempt to be flexible in approving the 
applications it receives, but will limit approved applications so as to not 
unreasonably interfere with the production from the existing non-compressed 
gas entering the system. DATENUMERIC Please submit your written application to 
Joe Thompson at the Dominion Gathering & Production Office. 
The application must indicate the amount of "incremental" gas for the 
specific compression agreement. DATENUMERIC Dominion recognizes that the installation 
of compression requires differing time frames. DATENUMERIC We will balance that 
consideration with our need to insure that the application process is 
not abused to the disadvantage of other producers; therefore, once granted, 
the applicant must have the compression in place and operable within 
six months of Dominion's approval, or the rights to all unconstructed 
capacity will be forfeited. DATENUMERIC In the event that more requests for compression 
rights for incremental gas are received than for which there is capacity, 
Dominion will award the rights on a prorated basis. 
Please include in your written request the mid number or a map of the 
proposed location where you will be requesting to install compression. 
Also include the incremental volume you are wishing to transport under 
the compression agreement. DATENUMERIC Your name, company name and address, 
state of incorporation, phone and fax number, as well as an e-mail address, 
if available, should be included (please print or type). 
Forward this information to: 
Joseph A. Thompson 
Manager, Business Development 
Dominion Transmission 
Gathering & Production Division 
DATENUMERIC Davisson Run Road 
After all requests are received, we will review the request and make a 
determination on granting compression based on capacity available and the 
capacity requests. DATENUMERIC You will be contacted as soon as possible after June INTNUMERIC 
to notify you of those requests that have been approved. DATENUMERIC Please realize that 
this is a "window" and the opportunity will close after Noon on June INTNUMERIC DATENUMERIC 
I hope that this will provide opportunity for you to increase the value 
of your production facilities, and I look forward to working with you on this 
opportunity to add compression. DATENUMERIC You can contact Joe Thompson at DECNUMERIC 
or Dan Stuart at DECNUMERIC DATENUMERIC with any questions you may have regarding 
this compression DATENUMERIC "open season" request on Dominion Gathering. 
H. Dale Rexrode 
Director, Producer Services & Business Development

Di rector, Producer Services & Business Development 
Dear West Virginia Producer, 
Over the last several years, Dominion Transmission has worked hard providing 
additional value to producers on its gathering system and 
through innovative projects and joint ventures. DATENUMERIC In continuing with 
that process to bring you more value for your local production and to 
improve the efficiency of our gathering system, we would like to continue a 
process where compression into our gathering system may be approved. 
We have been able to grant a limited number of these requests in the past, 
and would now like to make this opportunity somewhat more widely available to 
the producers. 
For this second offering, the process we will use is as follows: 
the Gathering and Production Division of Dominion Transmission will accept 
applications for compression rights into its gathering system for gas 
feeding the Barbour County High Pressure System. DATENUMERIC The Dominion "bubble" 
affected is DATENUMERIC DATENUMERIC DATENUMERIC Dominion recognizes that, although limited, there does 
exist the incremental capacity for throughput through these compressor 
The incremental capacity authorized through new compression agreements 
will not exceed the limit Dominion determines to be the capacity of the 
pipeline system. DATENUMERIC Dominion will attempt to be flexible in approving the 
applications it receives, but will limit approved applications so as to not 
unreasonably interfere with the production from the existing non-compressed 
gas entering the system. DATENUMERIC Please submit your written application to 
Joe Thompson at the Dominion Gathering & Production Office. 
The application must indicate the amount of "incremental" gas for the 
specific compression agreement. DATENUMERIC Dominion recognizes that the installation 
of compression requires differing time frames. DATENUMERIC We will balance that 
consideration with our need to insure that the application process is 
not abused to the disadvantage of other producers; therefore, once granted, 
the applicant must have the compression in place and operable within 
six months of Dominion's approval, or the rights to all unconstructed 
capacity will be forfeited. DATENUMERIC In the event that more requests for compression 
rights for incremental gas are received than for which there is capacity, 
Dominion will award the rights on a prorated basis. 
Please include in your written request the mid number or a map of the 
proposed location where you will be requesting to install compression. 
Also include the incremental volume you are wishing to transport under 
the compression agreement. DATENUMERIC Your name, company name and address, 
state of incorporation, phone and fax number, as well as an e-mail address, 
if available, should be included (please print or type). 
Forward this information to: 
Joseph A. Thompson 
Manager, Business Development 
Dominion Transmission 
Gathering & Production Division 
DATENUMERIC Davisson Run Road 
After all requests are received, we will review the request and make a 
determination on granting compression based on capacity available and the 
capacity requests. DATENUMERIC You will be contacted as soon as possible after June INTNUMERIC 
to notify you of those requests that have been approved. DATENUMERIC Please realize that 
this is a "window" and the opportunity will close after Noon on June INTNUMERIC DATENUMERIC 
I hope that this will provide opportunity for you to increase the value 
of your production facilities, and I look forward to working with you on this 
opportunity to add compression. DATENUMERIC You can contact Joe Thompson at DECNUMERIC 
or Dan Stuart at DECNUMERIC DATENUMERIC with any questions you may have regarding 
this compression DATENUMERIC "open season" request on Dominion Gathering. 
H. Dale Rexrode 
Director, Producer Services & Business Development

APPALACHIAN PRODUCER NOTICE 
Dear West Virginia Producer, 
Over the last several years, Dominion Transmission has worked hard providing 
additional value to producers on its gathering system and through innovative 
projects and joint ventures. DATENUMERIC In continuing with that process to bring you 
more value for your local production and to improve the efficiency of our 
gathering system, we would like to continue a process where compression 
into our gathering system may be approved. DATENUMERIC We have been able to grant a 
limited number of these requests in the past, and would now like to make 
this opportunity somewhat more widely available to the producers. 
For this second offering, the process we will use is as follows: DATENUMERIC For a 
period of DATENUMERIC days, beginning DATENUMERIC Noon on May INTNUMERIC INTNUMERIC the Gathering and 
Production Division of Dominion Transmission will accept applications for 
compression rights into its gathering system for gas feeding its SCHUTTE 
compressor station. DATENUMERIC The Dominion "bubbles" affected are DATENUMERIC & DATENUMERIC 
Dominion recognizes that, although limited, there does exist the incremental 
capacity for throughput through these compressor stations. DATENUMERIC The incremental 
capacity authorized through new compression agreements will not exceed the 
limit Dominion determines to be the capacity of the existing compressors. 
Dominion will attempt to be flexible in approving the applications it 
receives, but will limit approved applications so as to not unreasonably 
interfere with the production from the existing non-compressed gas entering 
the system. DATENUMERIC Please submit your written application to Joe Thompson at the 
Dominion Gathering & Production Office. DATENUMERIC The application must indicate the 
amount of "incremental" gas for the specific compression agreement. 
Dominion recognizes that the installation of compression requires differing 
time frames. DATENUMERIC We will balance that consideration with our need to insure 
that the application process is not abused to the disadvantage of other 
producers; therefore, once granted, the applicant must have the compression 
in place and operable within six months of Dominion's approval, or the rights 
to all unconstructed capacity will be forfeited. DATENUMERIC In the event that more 
requests for compression rights for incremental gas are received than for 
which there is capacity, Dominion will award the rights on a prorated basis. 
Please include in your written request the mid number or a map of the 
location where you will be requesting to install compression. DATENUMERIC Also include 
the incremental volume you are wishing to transport under the compression 
agreement. DATENUMERIC Your name, company name and address, state of incorporation, 
phone and fax number, as well as an e-mail address, if available, should 
be included (please print or type). 
Forward this information to: 
Joseph A. Thompson 
Manager, Business Development 
Dominion Transmission 
Gathering & Production Division 
DATENUMERIC Davisson Run Road 
After all requests are received, we will review the request and make a 
determination on granting compression based on capacity available and the 
capacity requests. DATENUMERIC You will be contacted as soon as possible after 
June INTNUMERIC DATENUMERIC to notify you of those requests that have been approved. 
Please realize that this is a "window" and the opportunity will close 
I hope that this will provide opportunity for you to increase the value 
of your production facilities, and I look forward to working with you on 
this opportunity to add compression. DATENUMERIC You can contact Joe Thompson at 
have regarding this compression DATENUMERIC "open season" request on Dominion Gathering.

New Virus Taking Offices By Storm 
This virus warning is genuine. 
There is a new virus going around, called "work." DATENUMERIC DATENUMERIC If you receive any sort 
of "work" at all, whether via email, Internet or simply handed to you by a 
colleague...DO NOT OPEN IT. 
This has been circulating around our building for months and those who have 
been tempted to open "work" or even look at "work" have found that their 
social life is deleted and their brain ceases to function properly. DATENUMERIC If you 
do encounter "work" via email or are faced with any "work" at all, then to 
purge the virus, send an email to your boss with the words "I've had enough 
of your crap... DATENUMERIC I'm off to the bar." DATENUMERIC DATENUMERIC DATENUMERIC Your brain should automatically 
forget the "work". 
If you receive "work" in paper-document form, simply lift the document and 
drag the "work" to your garbage can. DATENUMERIC Put on your hat and coat and skip to 
the nearest bar with two friends and order three bottles of beer DATENUMERIC (or rum 
punch). After repeating this action DATENUMERIC times, you will find DATENUMERIC that "work" 
will no longer be of any relevance to you DATENUMERIC and that "Scooby Doo" was the 
greatest cartoon ever. 
As usual, you are awesome! DATENUMERIC Let Steve know what the fuel waivers are when you 
I sent all the paperwork to Pam for the June fuel waiver requests this 
morning. DATENUMERIC I will let you know when I hear about the results. DATENUMERIC DATENUMERIC Thanks- AZ
